newsitem.title: USA: Novavax gets FDA OK for ESTRASORB study.
newsitem.headline: Novavax gets FDA OK for ESTRASORB study.

text.p: Novavax Inc said Tuesday it received permission from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration to proceed with pharmacokinetic-dose response studies of ESTRASORB.
ESTRASORB is a proprietary topical micellar nanoparticle cream containing encapsulated natural human estrogen, in symptomatic, menopausal women, the company said.
ESTRASORB is the first in a series of encapsulated topical drug product candidates using Novavax's proprietary delivery technology to enter pharmacokinetic-dose response studies, the company said.
In the study approved today, the company said an initial group of 10 women will receive 7.5 mg of estrogen daily for two weeks.
Novavax said it also received permission to dose additional patient groups at higher or lower doses in this study.
